Detectors and Sensitivity Tests

Detectors

Detectors combine contrail detection algorithms with scenes and imagers to simulate the detectability of a contrail.

class simtrails.contrail_detector.ContrailDetector(imager: Imager, algorithm: ContrailDetectionAlgorithm)[source]

Class representing a contrail detector (imager-algorithm combination).

imager

The imager used for capturing scenes.

Type:

Imager

algorithm

The algorithm used for contrail detection.

Type:

ContrailDetectionAlgorithm

contrail_mask(scene: Detectable, pbar=None, ax=None, **plot_kwargs) → ndarray[source]

Generates a contrail mask for a given detectable scene.

Parameters:

  • scene (Detectable) – The scene to generate the contrail mask for.

  • pbar (tqdm.tqdm, optional) – Progress bar to display the progress of the contrail detection algorithm.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional) – Axes to plot the scene and contrail mask.

Returns:

The contrail mask.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class simtrails.contrail_detector.GOESMannsteinDetector(resolution: float = 0.5, **mannstein_kwargs)[source]

A class representing a contrail detector using GOES imager and Mannstein algorithm.

imager

The GOES imager object used for contrail detection.

Type:

GOESImager

algorithm

The Mannstein algorithm object used for contrail detection.

Type:

MannsteinCDA

Parameters:

resolution (float) – The resolution of the imager in kilometers.

Sensitivity tests

Sensitivity tests are used to determine the sensitivity of contrail detection to variations in imager or scene parameters.

The sensitivity test uses detector_generator and detectable_generator, to create instances of detectors and detectables with varying parameters. These can be simply copies of the original detector/detectable, or can be more complex instances of InstanceGenerator.

class simtrails.sensitivity_test.CDASensitivityTest(detector_generator: InstanceGenerator | Callable[[...], ContrailDetector] | ContrailDetector, detectable_generator: InstanceGenerator | Callable[[...], Detectable] | Detectable, cda_properties: dict[str, Any] = {})[source]

Class representing a sensitivity test for contrail detection.

Parameters:

  • detector_generator (InstanceGenerator | Callable[..., ContrailDetector] | ContrailDetector) – Generator or callable that produces instances of ContrailDetector.

  • detectable_generator (InstanceGenerator | Callable[..., Detectable] | Detectable) – Generator or callable that produces instances of Detectable.

repeats(n: int, values: dict[str, ~typing.Iterable], agg=<function sum>, n_proc=4, record_optical_depth=False, **kw_attrs)[source]

Run multiple repeats of the sensitivity test.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of repeats.

  • values (dict[str, Iterable]) – Dictionary of parameter values to vary.

  • agg (callable, optional) – Aggregation function to apply to the results. Defaults to np.sum.

  • n_proc (int, optional) – Number of processes to use for parallel execution. Defaults to 4.

  • record_optical_depth (bool, optional) – Whether to record optical depth. Defaults to False.

  • **kw_attrs – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

Result of the sensitivity test.

Return type:

SensitivityResult

class simtrails.sensitivity_test.InstanceGenerator(generator_class, **kwargs)[source]

A class that generates instances based on a given generator class and parameters.

Parameters:

  • generator_class (callable) – The generator class or function used to generate instances.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be passed to the generator class.

Raises:

ValueError – If the generator_class is not callable but kwargs were passed.

Returns:

The generated instance.

get_variations(values: dict[str, Iterable], **kwargs)[source]

Generate variations of instances based on the given parameter values.

Parameters:

values (dict[str, Iterable]) – A dictionary of parameter names and their corresponding values.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing the variations of parameter values. variations (list): A list of generated instances with different parameter values.

Return type:

variations_kwargs (list[dict])
